history.content:
It's tough to say. CS168 for instance is only offered in the Fall, and many other courses depend on the professor teaching so sometimes they may not be offered because they can't find a suitable professor (e.g. CS186, CS184). The fall and spring courses shouldn't really matter for you though since you can always take it in Sophomore Spring or Senior Fall, etc.

As for recruiting, it's also tough to say. Many people get offers in the Fall, but it's often more difficult in the Fall but it's nice knowing that you have something set for the summer while you're abroad. At the same time, it's also stressful because if you don't find an internship in that time, you'll most likely be very stressed out in the Spring when you're abroad and can't attend anymore career fairs.

Most people I know get offers in the Spring since more companies start hiring at that time. There's a roughly an equal amount of Career Fairs in both Spring and Fall but I would say Spring is better for recruitment since you have a larger selection and actually more time since you can keep recruiting until the semester ends and you won't have the stressful deadline of you going abroad that you would have if you recruited in the Fall.

It's really up to you. Would you rather have the stress of an impending deadline but also a peace of mind if you did actually find an internship, or the greater odds of Spring recruitment but the uncertainty and worry while you're abroad of whether or not you'll be able to find a job.

It's tough to say. CS168 for instance is only offered in the Fall, and many other courses depend on the professor teaching so sometimes they may not be offered because they can't find a suitable professor (e.g. CS186, CS184). The fall and spring courses shouldn't really matter for you though since you can always take it in Sophomore Spring or Senior Fall, etc.

As for recruiting, it's also tough to say. Many people get offers in the Fall, but it's often more difficult in the Fall but it's nice knowing that you have something set for the summer while you're abroad. At the same time, it's also stressful because if you don't find an internship in that time, you'll most likely be very stressed out in the Spring when you're abroad and can't attend anymore career fairs.

Most people I know get offers in the Spring since more companies start hiring at that time. There's a roughly an equal amount of Career Fairs in both Spring and Fall but I would say Spring is better for recruitment since you have a larger selection and actually more time since you can keep recruiting until the semester ends and you won't have the stressful deadline of you going abroad that you would have if you recruited in the Fall.

children.subject: In people's experience, do large, more well known companies tend to recruit more in the fall (compared to smaller companies)?

history.content:
I'm a rising sophomore and am planning to study abroad junior year, wondering if it's better to go in the fall or spring? I won't have taken any upper divs (other than data100) but will have been through 61ABC and 70. 

Just trying to plan for internship recruiting, or if there are certain classes that are only offered one semester etc. Which semester do people think it's better to miss?
history.subject: Study abroad fall or spring?
